intro: Geocaryum creticum, commonly known as the Mediterranean sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a succulent, fleshy stem and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, helping it retain moisture in its arid environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing along rocky shores or in coastal dunes. Geocaryum creticum is an important plant in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various small animals and insects.
